Description: Goethite cylinder seal; contest scene; the design consists of three pairs of contestants; a bull-man and a hero; a lion and a bull-man; an inverted bull and a hero. The bull-man and the heroes (one of which is Gilgamesh?) are shown full-face ad the heroes are naked except for a belt. In the field is a monkey; the surface is damaged in places and there is a fault in the stone.
Bibliographic references: Collon 1986a / Catalogue of the Western Asiatic Seals in the British Museum: Cylinder Seals III: Isin-Larsa and Old Babylonian Periods (114)
Leichty E et al 1988a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum, volume VIII: Tablets from Sippar 3 (p.300)
Condition: Fair; the surface is damaged in places and there is a fault in the stone.
Acquisition name: From: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
